commit_message:
Fix app cred create without project_id for domain admins

Users with domain admin role that are not cloud admins are
not able to get scoped context and create an application
credential with project_id, so this change forces the
scoped context in that particular case.

Closes-bug: #1827120
Change-Id: I076a97a6f943ab74a2db8bc5179a7db194009db4

subject: Fix creation of protected image for old user code
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-04-21 19:10:44.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/image/v2/_proxy.py'], 'message': 'Fix creation of protected image for old user code

Commit afb49692 [1][2] replaced "protected" with "is_protected" in
raw image properties in order to fix an server-side schema validation
error (400 Bad Request) when defining image properties. That change
broke user code which calls e.g. create_image() with "protected"
instead of "is_protected" causing the exact server-side schema
validation error which it tried to fix for "is_protected" [3].

This patch readds "protected" to raw image properties and thus allows
clients to continue to use the old "protected" attribute.

Ref.:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/afb49692f5bfab259af8c594eedbddcb52cbde81
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/820926
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+bug/1927215

Change-Id: I37b046dd71c29734504cf55f272b6dffbb8b2aad
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix creation of protected image for old user code

Commit afb49692 [1][2] replaced "protected" with "is_protected" in
raw image properties in order to fix an server-side schema validation
error (400 Bad Request) when defining image properties. That change
broke user code which calls e.g. create_image() with "protected"
instead of "is_protected" causing the exact server-side schema
validation error which it tried to fix for "is_protected" [3].

This patch readds "protected" to raw image properties and thus allows
clients to continue to use the old "protected" attribute.

Ref.:
[1] https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/commit/afb49692f5bfab259af8c594eedbddcb52cbde81
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/820926
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-glanceclient/+bug/1927215

Change-Id: I37b046dd71c29734504cf55f272b6dffbb8b2aad

commit_message:
Fix backup metadata management and update

max_microversion on the backup resource was missed causing no
microversion to be enabled at all for it. This leads to server refusing
managing metadata of the backup. Fix this and add corresponding test
with attempting to set metadata.
Since this change sets microversion we also need to ensure we add all
attributes of this version - encryption_key_id is the one added last.

Change-Id: I2c161ca30524bf230104958b8afdd8cf0b682a89

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix SnapMirror snapshots not being cleaned up

Replica promote is retaining unneeded snapshots from previous
SnapMirror relationships and increasing the amount of space
consumed from snapshots in the storage system.

This patch fixes the issue by calling the snapmirror release
operation after resync completes its transferring, which allows
the SnapMirror software to properly cleanup unneeded resources.

Closes-Bug: #1982808
Change-Id: I516fb3575e30d18d971d6a1b7f3b9ad7120c3bbd

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-11-02 08:46:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove console_type parameter for server_mks_console function

The "get_mks_console" use "console_type" as param, but causes an issue on Nova.
In horizon logs we have "Recoverable error: No available console found." and in the dashboard we have "Unable to load console. Please reload page to try again." when we load the console.

', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Remove console_type parameter for server_mks_console function

The "get_mks_console" use "console_type" as param, but causes an issue on Nova.
In horizon logs we have "Recoverable error: No available console found." and in the dashboard we have "Unable to load console. Please reload page to try again." when we load the console.
There is no need to call the function with this parameter, as it's already defined automatically since microversion 2.53.

Change-Id: I776b19f053ca74c699ca069e04553740f1e83b3e

charmstore. Updated to point at charmhub, and ensure that they are
yoga/edge for the stable/yoga branch.

commit_message:
Avoid pick_default to detect promoted_max

This fixes the regression caused by [1], and avoid usage of
pick_default, which converts undef to an empty string ('').

Usage of an empty string causes type validation failure later when
the pcmk_bundle resource is defined.

[1] c332d43db6b81d44f56a5a4a67d9988df763b4de

Closes-Bug: #1995565
Change-Id: Ib909f45b237a478119d4f90ce9f7b752668bad9d

commit_message:
Enable --retain option for zebra daemon

Using the retain option when starting zebra allows operators to
not lose routes installed by zebra from the kernel when stopping
frr/zebra.

Change-Id: Ie4936401c8567204029a493e5d3b77d1ce7cc5a6

subject: Fix the invalid glance client test
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-31 10:20:39.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/common/glance_service/image_service.py', 'ironic/common/utils.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/common/test_glance_service.py', 'ironic/conf/glance.py'], 'message': "Fix the invalid glance client test

It relied on mocking tenacity.retry, but it's executed on class
initialization. Depending on the ordering, it may do nothing or
it may replace ImageService.call with a mock.

Instead, add a new tenacity helper that loads an option in runtime.
As a nice side effect, [glance]num_retries is now mutable.

Change-Id: I2e02231d294997e824db77c998ef8d352fa69075
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix the invalid glance client test

It relied on mocking tenacity.retry, but it's executed on class
initialization. Depending on the ordering, it may do nothing or
it may replace ImageService.call with a mock.

Instead, add a new tenacity helper that loads an option in runtime.
As a nice side effect, [glance]num_retries is now mutable.

Change-Id: I2e02231d294997e824db77c998ef8d352fa69075

commit_message:
Don't test EOL cinderlib branches

cinderlib stable/ussuri went EOL with change I75092342fe68.
cinderlib stable/train went EOL with change I25d78267ab4a.
Revise the cinder-tempest-plugin-lvm-barbican-base job for
these branches so that they don't run the cinderlib functional
tests.

Change-Id: I2c66fcb64ffe1ac4a03778e7a11c67fbd20166ba

This change makes the root user, instead of the swift user, own

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-10-20 02:34:08.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/storage/mount.pp'], 'message': 'Prohibit write to the mount directory

the mount path where the data disk is mounted. This allows us to
prevent the swift processes from writing files.

This follows the current installation doc(eg. [1]) which suggests

Change-Id: I1a612fcf658da8ed0cb1dc51fa5e534dc0341241
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Prohibit write to the mount directory

This change makes the root user, instead of the swift user, own
the mount path where the data disk is mounted. This allows us to
prevent the swift processes from writing files.

This follows the current installation doc(eg. [1]) which suggests
chown AFTER mounting the disk device.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/install/storage-install-rdo.html

Change-Id: I1a612fcf658da8ed0cb1dc51fa5e534dc0341241

commit_message:
[horizon] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I930214ed8c119bb62b3d06fab34eb19e3c5e2ca0

commit_message:
[NetApp] Support NFS shares on windows

Set following 4 attributes when creating nfs shares:
    showmount:          enabled
    v3-ms-dos-client:   support
    v3-connection-drop: disable
    ejukebox-errors:    disable

Change-Id: I86c3de32d36940e85545fcb337723e4b3edce216
Closes-bug: 1901937
Co-authored-by: Maurice Escher <maurice.escher@sap.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5e01d9e292582bbd1e6a87cec8b92874996585f7)
(cherry picked from commit 1af6f4925111a58c15f8ce2789933243f31ffc9f)

subject: Fix flavor id auto generation
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 19:17:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/flavors/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Fix flavor id auto generation

Currently the flavor creation form always check for the uniqueness
of the UUID field, even when it is set to "auto". That means that if
we create a flavor with UUID value of "auto", the check will fail.

This patch disable the check when UUID is automatically generated.

Change-Id: Ie31307d67cf3857e3bb80c124e92c81e0c6a2982
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix flavor id auto generation

Currently the flavor creation form always check for the uniqueness
of the UUID field, even when it is set to "auto". That means that if
we create a flavor with UUID value of "auto", the check will fail.

This patch disable the check when UUID is automatically generated.

Change-Id: Ie31307d67cf3857e3bb80c124e92c81e0c6a2982

commit_message:
Update _CLOSED_SERIES set with Wallaby

Validation is not needed for a series as soon as it reaches the
Extended Maintenance state as there won't be any releases from such
branches. This patch updates the set of closed series to avoid
unnecessary validation.

Change-Id: I0f093865bab190273421d966c755434d0369e0a0

commit_message:

Some projects like cinder have dropped support for Python 3.6 and are
no longer compatible with CentOS Stream 8 which uses Python 3.6 as
the default runtime.

Add deprecation warning in pingtest

Pingtest is deprecated for a long time.
Adding warning saying this will be removed at the end of Victoria cycle
This is also an effort to consolidate cirros image variables to be
easier to update or downgrade the cirros version

commit_message:
Add doc of OAuth 2.0 Mutual-TLS Authenticate

The OAuth2.0 Access Token API is modified, support to get an OAuth2.0
certificate-bound access token from the keystone identity server with
OAuth 2.0 credentials and Mutual-TLS certificates.

Implements: blueprint support-oauth2-mtls
Change-Id: Ib1c391b06b167c55435360b81bb67c19a63c8b26

commit_message:
Add doc of OAuth 2.0 Mutual-TLS Authenticate

Added a new OAuth2mTlsClientCredential plugin, accessible via the
'v3oauth2mtlsclientcredential' entry point, making possible to
authenticate using an OAuth 2.0 Mutual-TLS client credentials.

Implements: blueprint support-oauth2-mtls
Change-Id: I4b85bcfbfad1e34624b48ecd6476d01a4adba9eb

[{'created': '2022-10-12 12:43:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable epel repository for more than CentOS

The epel repository contains among other things 'debootstrap',
which is needed by dib_host_required_packages, whenever
dib_os_element contains the word 'debian' (or 'ubuntu'), which
is the default[1] and install_dib is true which it also is by
default[2]

This improves upon I57513883c0fa8d6ffb2c70debb81d5e7e6d8b221
where the documentation[3] and procedure has probably been updated
since it was last followed. We can also remove the conditional
installation of dib_host_required_packages with enablerepo: epel
for centos

[1] bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:dib_os_element: "debian"

    bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:use_cirros: false
[3] https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/epel/#_el9

commit_message:
Enable epel repository for more than CentOS

The epel repository contains among other things 'debootstrap',
which is needed by dib_host_required_packages, whenever
dib_os_element contains the word 'debian' (or 'ubuntu'), which
is the default[1] and install_dib is true which it also is by
default[2]

This improves upon I57513883c0fa8d6ffb2c70debb81d5e7e6d8b221
where the documentation[3] and procedure has probably been updated
since it was last followed. We can also remove the conditional
installation of dib_host_required_packages with enablerepo: epel
for centos

[1] bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:dib_os_element: "debian"
[2] bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:install_dib: "{{ create_image_via_dib | bool or create_ipa_image | bool }}"
    bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:create_image_via_dib: "{{ not use_cirros | default(false) | bool }}"
    bifrost-ironic-install/defaults/main.yml:use_cirros: false
[3] https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/epel/#_el9

commit_message:
Debian/Ubuntu: Fix installation of pxelinux.0 and syslinux files

Debian and Ubuntu requires the separate pxelinux package to use
the pxelinux.0 file and the file is stored in a separated directory.

Also, the current directory to locate the syslinux files are outdated
and does not work with the recent versions.

This change fixes these two problems.

Conflicts:
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/ironic_pxe_spec.rb

Change-Id: I560b3b6af5b2bab0b1144aa1eda6088f01336d75
(cherry picked from commit b780aca6499a7504ef72195eb4243801d53ea5aa)
(cherry picked from commit fca5c064bede04d2a1ef9874e2b8b0ca5f5b029f)

[{'created': '2022-11-04 05:23:14.000000000', 'files': ['src/charm.py'], 'message': 'Restart nova-scheduler service after bootstrap

Nova cell cell1 is created as part of bootstrap

after the cells are created, otherwise the nodes

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-ops-sunbeam/+/863584

commit_message:
Restart nova-scheduler service after bootstrap

Nova cell cell1 is created as part of bootstrap
process and nova-scheduler should be restarted
after the cells are created, otherwise the nodes
attached to the cell are not considered for
scheduling.

Restart the nova-scheduler service as last step
of configure_charm()

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-ops-sunbeam/+/863584
Change-Id: I953d5f65dc5df79e5da7c8fa03e2bff88c6343ee

subject: Add functional tests to reproduce bug #1994983
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 16:47:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add functional tests to reproduce bug #1994983

If user issues an API call to stop a libvirt
instance when its compute node (source compute) is is offline and
then evacuates this instance, then evacuated instance would be
stopped when source compute node will come back online.

Nova Libvirt interface shouldn't ignore InstanceNotFound exception
when stopping an instance and change instance's DB state
afterwards.

Queued instance stop call received by compute node which no longer
hosts instance shouldn't be processed. Fake virt driver will not
change instance's state, but will process a call itself.

commit_message:
Add functional tests to reproduce bug #1994983

If user issues an API call to stop a libvirt
instance when its compute node (source compute) is is offline and
then evacuates this instance, then evacuated instance would be
stopped when source compute node will come back online.

Nova Libvirt interface shouldn't ignore InstanceNotFound exception
when stopping an instance and change instance's DB state
afterwards.

Queued instance stop call received by compute node which no longer
hosts instance shouldn't be processed. Fake virt driver will not
change instance's state, but will process a call itself.

Related-bug: #1994983
Change-Id: I78a20b649f8b7e3b0cad14ba8a8b8feb3541cd47

commit_message:
In nova_cc_utils.py:resolve_hosts_for: .append -> .add

The method was refactored (in part) to use sets to enforce uniqueness of
the hosts.  Unfortunately, a list method (.append()) slipped through
that should have been converted to .add(). This fixes that error.

Change-Id: I248430cd1a9156efab745fe110a39441b503b3a5
Closes-Bug: #1992789
(cherry picked from commit 007f9e33b0f111bcd22aebfa785bb5066832e802)

subject: Remove mariadb-connector-c during upgrades
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-03 12:00:42.000000000', 'files': ['vars/redhat.yml'], 'message': "Remove mariadb-connector-c during upgrades

mariadb-connector-c package is being installed with native mariadb,
as CentOS 9 Stream support was added at times when MariaDB was not
providing repo for it's installation. Now, since we bumped version
to 10.6.10 and install MariaDB for CentOS from MariaDB repo, upgrade
path is broken, since mariadb-connector-c is conflicting with
MariaDB-shared that provides same functionality. We need to add
mariadb-connector-c to the packages that are removed during upgrade not
to break upgrades.

Change-Id: I002a60cf1091e05bf1b0b5d066df97795b5123fc
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove mariadb-connector-c during upgrades

mariadb-connector-c package is being installed with native mariadb,
as CentOS 9 Stream support was added at times when MariaDB was not
providing repo for it's installation. Now, since we bumped version
to 10.6.10 and install MariaDB for CentOS from MariaDB repo, upgrade
path is broken, since mariadb-connector-c is conflicting with
MariaDB-shared that provides same functionality. We need to add
mariadb-connector-c to the packages that are removed during upgrade not
to break upgrades.

Change-Id: I002a60cf1091e05bf1b0b5d066df97795b5123fc

commit_message:
Switch pacemaker remote channels

The papermaker-remote charm is distro based, rather than OpenStack
release based. This has recently been corrected in the pacemaker-remote
charmhub entry, and stable branches, so this change aligns the bundles
to work with the new focal/edge and jammy/edge tracks.

Change-Id: I36a6e84de29070e524610e86a486830cf5d0d7e7

commit_message:
[Doc] Fix tox command option to run smoke tests

This commit fixes the tox command option to run the smoke tests. The
original arguments fail with the error[1], and `-efull` and
`tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops` are not for the smoke tests.

[1]
 $ tox -efull tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops
 ...
 tempest run: error: unrecognized arguments: tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops

Change-Id: I9c3dd9fb4f64bf856c5cab88a2aeaae355c84a65

commit_message:
Release glance for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to glance since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 22.1.0..677c89c23
677c89c23 Fix set_property_atomic() boolean type casting
b1d635c28 Fix failing copy_image flow init
fdf7b80da [stable-only] Specify openstacksdk stable branch

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I92edcd0798d4eaef9b1e4e367d5ebdae37165db8

subject: [NetApp] Fix lack of aggregate pool home state
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-09 16:55:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[NetApp] Fix lack of aggregate pool home state

The NetApp driver is not reporting the home state of the aggregate
pools. This information is useful during maintance tasks, since
not home aggregate cannot create shares.

This patch adds to the report netapp capabilties the boolean
`netapp_is_home`.

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix lack of aggregate pool home state

The NetApp driver is not reporting the home state of the aggregate
pools. This information is useful during maintenance tasks, since
not home aggregate cannot create shares.

This patch adds to the report netapp capabilities the boolean
`netapp_is_home`.

Closes-Bug: #1927823
Change-Id: I8e98541d8e457e9e4609410853b50d6156465f61

commit_message:
onlyHostFilter: Fix follow-up suggestions.

1. Change context as first argument to function.
2. Fix spelling mistake in version history
3. Add new host_admin RBAC policy which is applied in onlyHostFilter
since non-admin user as well needs to create share on specific host.

Change-Id: Id2c09ebab874ec983da7f26370932d46a0447801

commit_message:
os-net-config runs ethtool command without restarting interfaces

Previously, adding or modifying ETHTOOL_OPTS causes restarting
interfaces. It causes a downtime though ETHTOOL_OPTS can be applied
without restarting interfaces.
This change will apply ETHTOOL_OPTS via ethtool command when the option
is added or modified without restarting interfaces.

Closes-Bug: #1800237
Change-Id: I6445685b00ec98788426d0786e78c6d3750c9910

When a volume is created in NetApp ONTAP, it has a few autosize
attributes that are set by default. The values of the attributes
are defined according to the volume type (DP/RW).

During the replica promotion, the types are swaped between source
and destination volumes, but the autosize values were not being
updated. This patch fixes this behavior, calling an autosize reset
after promoting the replica.

Change-Id: I9a4e5763927b7585a8fbd6b0004d6a123dcd7fae

commit_message:
[NetApp] Fixed replica promotion to updated autosize attributes

When a volume is created in NetApp ONTAP, it has a few autosize
attributes that are set by default. The values of the attributes
are defined according to the volume type (DP/RW).

During the replica promotion, the types are swaped between source
and destination volumes, but the autosize values were not being
updated. This patch fixes this behavior, calling an autosize reset
after promoting the replica.

Closes-Bug: #1957075
Change-Id: I9a4e5763927b7585a8fbd6b0004d6a123dcd7fae

commit_message:
General tidy for module ready for release.

Refresh charm to drop release usage in ops-sunbeam.

Drop surplus template fragments.

Refresh unit tests.

Tidy requirements.txt.

Switch to black + other linters.

Tidy docstrings across operator.

Change-Id: Iabc3b12d8409d304ad3a021ebc293f0cd545e63d

commit_message:
Change start_all() as a notion of public function

Some cases require restart of services after the
bootstrap is completed. The restart function _start_all()
is in notion of private function and so need to be
changed to notion of public.

Change-Id: I739fc762d30c1810bafd2261d62041d4678fa6fc

subject: Delete s3api MPU segments when the manifest expires
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-13 17:47:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: expirer the entire s3api MPU

It's not possible to reference s3api MPU segments from s3api - they may
as well be in the reserved namespace.  Since X-Delete-At expiration will
only be set on the manifest; we should at least *try* to avoid creating
orphaned segments on purpose.

The use of SLO for s3api MPUs is an implementation detail.  Because SLO
segments are NOT in a reserved namespace it would be appropriate to
clean up SLOs automatically in this mannor.

This is just a best effort cleanup, s3api MPUs are already known to
generate orphaned segments [1].  A future feature "Atomic Large Object"
expiratoin will require processing new ALO tombstones rows in the
container such that we ALWAYS throw tombstones for segments under the
reference of the manifest's reserved namespace (possibly even if *their*
best effort inline cleanup attempt had already done so)

1. lp bug #1813202

Change-Id: Ib5cec0e552cd51592653e9e100729fcf91f99415

", 'number': 10}, {'created': '2022-01-13 20:13:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Delete s3api MPU segments when the manifest expires

The object-expirer will delete s3api MPU segments automatically when it
expires an s3api manifest.

This is just a best effort cleanup of the segments. In some
circumstances (e.g. when manifest objects are not consistent) this may
fail to delete all segments. However, s3api MPUs already have a related
bug to address orphaned segments.  The automatic deletion is only
applied to s3api segments, not to SLO segments in general, because:

(a) s3api segments cannot be referenced via the S3 API, and are
therefore orphaned as soon as the manifest is deleted; SLO segments in
general are not necessarily orphaned when a manifest is deleted.

(b) the names of s3api MPU segments can be easily inferred from the
manifest DELETE response headers without inspecting the manifest body.

Related-Bug: #1813202
Change-Id: Ib5cec0e552cd51592653e9e100729fcf91f99415

commit_message:
Delete s3api MPU segments when the manifest expires

The object-expirer will delete s3api MPU segments automatically when it
expires an s3api manifest.

This is just a best effort cleanup of the segments. In some
circumstances (e.g. when manifest objects are not consistent) this may
fail to delete all segments. However, s3api MPUs already have a related
bug to address orphaned segments.  The automatic deletion is only
applied to s3api segments, not to SLO segments in general, because:

(a) s3api segments cannot be referenced via the S3 API, and are
therefore orphaned as soon as the manifest is deleted; SLO segments in
general are not necessarily orphaned when a manifest is deleted.

(b) the names of s3api MPU segments can be easily inferred from the
manifest DELETE response headers without inspecting the manifest body.

Related-Bug: #1813202
Change-Id: Ib5cec0e552cd51592653e9e100729fcf91f99415

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs broken with latest cryptography

Pin cryptography to < 37.0.0[1].

Also, changes tripleo_keystone_resources role to use
centos:stream9 image.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/7126

Closes-Bug: #1995608
Change-Id: I6852de27f68f4dcf2cac44a80b3a491db1996d9f
(cherry picked from commit 0e0a80a8ab56b5bd6903a8b169d058b352843f2a)

General tidy for module ready for release.

Refresh charm to drop release usage in ops-sunbeam.

Drop surplus template fragments.

Refresh unit tests.

Tidy requirements.txt.

Switch to black + other linters.

commit_message:
Switch to pytest

nose has not seen active development for many years now. With py310, we
can no longer use it due to import errors.

Also update lower contraints

Closes-Bug: #1993531
Change-Id: I215ba0d4654c9c637c3b97953d8659ac80892db8

commit_message:
Move tuned_profiles_cpu_partitioning dependency in overcloud-base

The tuned-profiles-cpu-partitioning package is needed by Tuned service
deployed on all roles, including Ceph. This change moves the pacakge
dependency into overcloud-base to reflect that.

Without it, images built from overcloud-ceph-storage would not deploy
successfully.

Conflicts:
	elements/overcloud-base/install.d/package-installs-overcloud-base

Change-Id: I366bf97db7e3ee82a9fb70770fdc1de0db14f963
(cherry picked from commit edbc5c3b614a9b399e399a62b7b7caf38e006fff)
(cherry picked from commit dbedc655992f200b679e6e5125c1a054a52df6ce)

subject: Evaluate truthiness of inspector.discovery.enabled with bool filter
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-09 22:40:30.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/ironic-inspector.conf.j2'], 'message': "Evaluate truthiness of inspector.discovery.enabled with bool filter

In the case of passing in extra-vars to bifrost-cli

enable_inspector_discovery=True is a bool
enable_inspector_discovery=true is a str

We can use the bool filter to get a 'truthy' value from either case.

Change-Id: Idafde8762bebeebe02826990aeb1ba53b24e343f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Evaluate truthiness of inspector.discovery.enabled with bool filter

In the case of passing in extra-vars to bifrost-cli

enable_inspector_discovery=True is a bool
enable_inspector_discovery=true is a str

We can use the bool filter to get a 'truthy' value from either case.

Change-Id: Idafde8762bebeebe02826990aeb1ba53b24e343f

commit_message:
Remove unused iniparse python system dependency

Everything seems to run fine without it, and it's not included in
the debian system dependencies.

commit_message:
api-ref: Add docs for clusters

This API is currently undocumented, as I noticed while working on OSC
changes. There isn't anything too unusual going on here. The API was
first introduced in microversion 3.7 and was then extended with
replication-related information in 3.36. Both are accounted for here.

Change-Id: I86dc774c8d203839f4dadb13e93a416d112fc7b5
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Lucas de Oliveira <lucasmoliveira059@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: 1885544

commit_message:
Remove usage of undefined CONF.quota_metadata_items

This parameter is never added, and the logics relying on the parameter
is never called by any test case.

Closes-Bug: #1934036
Change-Id: I549badf6e35f9296c1bc02e684000049edab6b00

Move tuned_profiles_cpu_partitioning dependency in overcloud-base

The tuned-profiles-cpu-partitioning package is needed by Tuned service
deployed on all roles, including Ceph. This change moves the pacakge
dependency into overcloud-base to reflect that.

Without it, images built from overcloud-ceph-storage would not deploy
successfully.

commit_message:
General tidy for module ready for release.

Refresh charm to drop release usage in ops-sunbeam.

Drop surplus template fragments.

Refresh unit tests.

Tidy requirements.txt.

Switch to black + other linters.

Tidy docstrings across operator.

commit_message:
Fix api layer become slow when shutdown one control node

* add memcache_socket_timeout configuration variables
  and set the default value 0.25[0]
* add memcache_dead_retry configuration variables
  and set the default value to 900s[1]

* [0] https://review.opendev.org/519353
* [1] https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.cache/latest/configuration/#cache.memcache_dead_retry
Closes-Bug: #1980739

Change-Id: I47db333a1f0d735703e6559e2130315189e3d56e

commit_message:
Update metadata in setup.cfg

we are using some "aliases" that the setuptools docs say 
"are supported for compatibility reasons" but their use is not advised[1].

[1] https://setuptools.pypa.io/en/latest/userguide/declarative_config.html#metadata

maintaining setup.cfg as per other repos[2]

[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder-specs/+/822918

example : https://github.com/pypa/virtualenv/blob/main/setup.cfg

Change-Id: I992fc9c81a08474a04373ad1bfd710988517f0b8

subject: setuptools: Disable auto discovery
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 15:14:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3206bf16f6dce3823f3ae0e1ee63746d11f1e0c3
(cherry picked from commit 4e983c272085dab457e6d6352ecd0fa2f66f67a3)

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~

~~~

or

~~~

~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

commit_message:
Move base CI job to jammy

We'll want that by the time we can add a py310 job. It'll also make us
be explicit about the OS to use for py27 and py36-py39 jobs.

Also, update bindep so we don't try to install py2 stuff on jammy.

Change-Id: If70cd2fc03d10e55cd782ec8ffc87bd2b2b321ea

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

~~~

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

subject: setuptools: Disable auto discovery
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-02 15:14:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6a5ef0f4a3e8ee9b679c4217d5e3abd95c908332

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9ae55dfa5830356d7f2acba4df6be86954e2d5f6
(cherry picked from commit 18cddc6cecc91aa5117a7506f67a94ee3962f7dd)
(cherry picked from commit 4c58583745118c44e1536e96fa25e1605c27a226)

commit_message:
setuptools: Disable auto discovery

The latest release of setuptools 61.0 made a breaking change[1] and
because of this change 'pip install' fails with the following error.

~~~
error: Multiple top-level packages discovered in a flat-layout:
['lib', 'spec', 'manifests', 'releasenotes'].
~~~

Users that don't set 'packages', 'py_modules', or configuration'
are still likely to observe the auto-discovery behavior, which may
halt the build if the project contains multiple directories and/or
multiple Python files directly under the project root.

To disable auto discovery, one can do below in setup.py

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,packages=[],..)
~~~

or

~~~
setuptools.setup(..,py_modules=[],..)
~~~

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/3197

Note setup.py is not used to install puppet modules. However it is used
to generate a release note, thus should be fixed.

Conflicts:
	setup.py

commit_message:
Provide a playbook example to deploy minions

This patch aims to provide an example of an Ansible
playbook which will take care of deploying an Undercloud
minion with the tripleo-operator-ansible project.

commit_message:
Switch to proxy layer of the SDK for project

In previous change we switched to OpenStackModule. Now switch to usage
of the proxy layer directly. This also addresses possibility to create
subproject properly.
In the Keystone v3 it is not required to invoke create followed by
update - not sure why this was done fist.

Change-Id: I76d1e65160c5c83d7b2108cfc1e8f0662055783c
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/790095

commit_message:
Adding new parameter for the os_stack module

Which provides an option to skip the existing stack update.
By adding this parameter we are not changing any default behavior.

Change-Id: I34697db9a6c3b56720fdaed8dc4f06518f61afc9

commit_message:
ppc64le: Add altarch_excludes var for non x86 container builds

skydive is an x86 only container. This patch adds the a dict
called altarch_excludes that gets set only when building on non x86
hardware.

Change-Id: Iefbe9bc530a965d0651c5c4a4990f8e4d7e0b659
Co-Authored-By: Adam C Kimball <baha@astyr.net>

2.9 which are relevant.

commit_message:
Adding container engine to kolla_container_facts

Second part of patchset:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/799229/
in which was suggested to split patch into smaller ones.

This change adds container_engine variable to kolla_container_facts
module, this prepares module to be used with docker and podman as well
without further changes in roles.

Signed-off-by: Ivan Halomi <i.halomi@partner.samsung.com>
Co-authored-by: Martin Hiner <m.hiner@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: I9e8fa30646844ab4a288555f3aafdda345b3a118

commit_message:
Add possibility to allocate FIP without attaching

Add a regular CRUD capabilities to the floating_ip module for allocating
it without attaching to anything. A wider set of checks should be
covered, but for the beginning this should be sufficient.

Change-Id: I002395cbb05b84b5d0613023bfcf535ed83afc16

commit_message:
Allow freeipa to be installed on CentOS9

Following tweaks so far:
- CentOS 9 is not using modules for freeipa
- haveged does not exist in C9
- conditionalized epel-release as seems to be unneeded on CS9

Tested by deploying freeipa on centos9 using the
freeipa-setup role + this patch

Change-Id: Ie86e2d1cf1465095f17fcf877457f337903e3508

commit_message:
Collect more targeted infromation from browbeat

It seems a bit egregious to collect the full content of the
browbeat directory, as such we should just narrow that scope
down to what we really need to collect

Change-Id: Ib672797a25babe73afac73375d9ffbdd3a3b4c84

commit_message:
Enable IPA debug logging

This change increases IPA debugging level and explicitly configures a
--forward-policy instead of letting IPA use whatever it wants.

Change-Id: I794427e004f77e8644b68fadb407c04ae2a1b130

commit_message:
Condition ansible-collections-openstack version on release

In preparation for the coming breaking changes in
openstack-ansible-collections starting in Zed, this updates
quickstart.sh to install the version of the collections that's
compatible with the release being deployed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/844141

Change-Id: I014ef50269fc195f582d6d7e5cfe49294025ee30

corresponding to the containers preparation and the standalone
upgrade at such.

commit_message:
Adapt standalone-upgrade to run tripleo operator

Update the standalone-upgrade role to be more similar to the
standalone role by relying the containers-prepare-parameter
and the tripleo-upgrade steps in the corresponding tripleo-
operator-ansible roles.

This patch also, splits the code into two parts, the one
corresponding to the containers preparation and the standalone
upgrade at such.

Change-Id: I16d959fdb41e74c254c74e06d77a9a6e526797ad

[{'created': '2021-12-21 03:12:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'redhat-common: enforce DIB_RELEASE

We've noticed that the centos element is using a DIB_RELEASE of "9"
for 9-stream, and the centos-minimal element is using "9-stream".

This creates confusion in elements where some package maps are being
written for "9", others for "9-stream", and sometimes matches work
because of alphabetical sorting but other times we use == matching and
it doesn't.

I think the best place to verify this is probably in a early element
of redhat-common, which is included by all these elements.  This way
we can ensure that all these paths (that are not tested together) at
least agree on the DIB_RELEASE tags.

commit_message:
redhat-common: enforce DIB_RELEASE

We've noticed that the centos element is using a DIB_RELEASE of "9"
for 9-stream, and the centos-minimal element is using "9-stream".

This creates confusion in elements where some package maps are being
written for "9", others for "9-stream", and sometimes matches work
because of alphabetical sorting but other times we use == matching and
it doesn't.

I think the best place to verify this is probably in a early element
of redhat-common, which is included by all these elements.  This way
we can ensure that all these paths (that are not tested together) at
least agree on the DIB_RELEASE tags.

Change-Id: Ieedfb1d187572f63a98844116e4882fb8739ffee

commit_message:
Mellanox NICs' ifcfg-scripts should not be removed when no CONFIG change exists

os-net-config is triggering reconfiguration/flapping of
mellanox nics even when there are no changes in the NIC configs.
Added check to NOT remove ifcfg-* scripts for Mellonox NICs when
DPDK/Bond is enabled

Resolves: rhbz#2131248
Change-Id: Ida0c78ba7784d452165999af4dd955b0129cfdaf

subject: Refactor ironic deploy image handling.
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-03 18:12:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor ironic deploy image handling.

The deploy image is required in two places in an ironic deployment,
first as images uploaded to glance for the ironic service, and second
as files on a web server for the ironic-inspector service.

Previously this role only placed the deploy images on the ironic
inspector web server, but this patch provides the functionality to
also upload the images to glance.

The variables for ironic deploy image source locations are
consolidated so that only one set are required to run the tasks
for both ironic and ironic-inspector, and several overrides are
available allowing the source to be overidden to a local mirror
easily.

Finally - the name of the files placed on the inspector web server
and into glance represent the upstream name of the image files rather
than generic names which lose versioning and release information.

Change-Id: I1aed9d97a4ddbfb70d2375f5204c55374d1067c9

commit_message:
Refactor ironic deploy image handling.

The deploy image is required in two places in an ironic deployment,
first as images uploaded to glance for the ironic service, and second
as files on a web server for the ironic-inspector service.

Previously this role only placed the deploy images on the ironic
inspector web server, but this patch provides the functionality to
also upload the images to glance.

The variables for ironic deploy image source locations are
consolidated so that only one set are required to run the tasks
for both ironic and ironic-inspector, and several overrides are
available allowing the source to be overidden to a local mirror
easily.

Finally - the name of the files placed on the inspector web server
and into glance represent the upstream name of the image files rather
than generic names which lose versioning and release information.

Change-Id: I1aed9d97a4ddbfb70d2375f5204c55374d1067c9

commit_message:
[RBAC] Return 404 if share is inaccessible

When a user is prevented from listing a non-public
share, the API service would return a 403 Forbidden.
This isn't consistent with the API SIG's guidance
on resources restricted by virtue of RBAC policy since
users with malicious intent may use the signal to
mean that the resource exists.

Depends-On: I27fdd7dfffeb15965b66dbb3f6b1568c11ff9ad4
Change-Id: I7e05dcb343c932cc7fec8d395919053d0a1801ce
Closes-Bug: #1901210
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

The update_vip() method gets called in network_tasks.py without setting
the for_delete argument. That works because the actual network drivers
implement that function using a default for the for_delete argument.

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Align signature of AbstractNetworkDriver.update_vip method

The update_vip() method gets called in network_tasks.py without setting
the for_delete argument. That works because the actual network drivers
implement that function using a default for the for_delete argument.
This patch updates the signature of the respective base class in case a
driver does not overwrite this method.

Change-Id: I304e06d1d187070b260347926f3b516072827807

commit_message:
Define queues at project level

Defining queues at project.pipeline level was deprecated in release
4.1.0 of Zuul [1] and support for it will (probably) be dropped in
release 7.0.0. [2][3]

This patch isn't a clean cherry-pick since
we're including a bugfix for mysql-8 which is needed
by the unit tests running in the requirements check
job. We've to club these changes because the requirements
job is a voting job. [4]

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html
[3] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/836342

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ife023187f307f1190d5e76daf644db0b5cd55d38

commit_message:
[CI] Pin tempest plugin and scenario test image

Tempest is pinned to a 26.1.0 on this stable
branch [1]. manila-tempest-plugin in Zed requires a newer
tempest release [2] than this one. So, pin
manila-tempest-plugin as well to a version that can still
work with the pinned version of tempest.

Also, manila's test image (built from manila-image-elements)
is based off of Ubuntu 22.04 (Jammy Jellyfish) in the Zed
release; we don't need that image to be used to test this
stable branch and we could use an older version (based on
Ubuntu 20.04 - Focal Fossa) that requires less memory/CPU [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/838051
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/849995
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila-tempest-plugin/+/846061

Change-Id: Ic7213030dd433b765d5a815d8a31aee01b09da1c
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d68e16fb89c63828b4a6ffc8a95493eefff4baff)

commit_message:
Create entry for empty groups in inventory_rolemap

When a group is a child of another group then the child groups role mappings
are added to the parent group role mappings. This which fails with a
KeyError when the child is an empty group as no mapping is created.

Closes-bug: #1994081
Related: rhbz#2089512
Change-Id: I05f4989b0f14d56d3c33f91b3cccb85b729987cb

Change-Id: Ic56d5e192487d444afd0cdf0bce5e1a691ba087c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make integration tests stop on first failure

This should save us some time and decrease the server load. If a single
test failed, we already know the patch is bad (or the tests need to be
rerun) so it makes no sense to execute the rest of the tests on the
gate.

Change-Id: Ic56d5e192487d444afd0cdf0bce5e1a691ba087c

commit_message:
Drop py2 and mysql bits from bindep

py2 has been deprecated couple of years ago and is not part of PTI
Moreover modern operating systems are not capable of installing it

mysql can be safely replaced with mariadb for consistency with rpm

commit_message:
Add filesystem info to FSAL in CephFS NFS

The filesystem information was missing from the exports
in the CephFS NFS driver. Because of this, the exports
were created on the first available filesystem.

This generates inconsistencies in deployments in which more than
one filesystem is being used.

This patch set adds the filesystem information in the
created exports.

Closes-Bug: #1991938
Change-Id: I639640f738571c77ea9bb1fbf60749c00ffcbd3b

commit_message:
Fix molecule jobs broken with latest cryptography

Pin cryptography to < 37.0.0[1].

Also, changes tripleo_keystone_resources role to use
centos:stream9 image.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/7126

Closes-Bug: #1995608
Change-Id: I6852de27f68f4dcf2cac44a80b3a491db1996d9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-03 15:51:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP - Refactoring preflight checks and validations

The goal of this review is to refactor the preflight checks
for undercloud, tripleo and overcloud deploy in order to
centralized all those checks into a common place in tripleo-validations.
The major gain of this approach is:
* allow operators to run preflight checks on demmand, outside of the
  tripleo CLI deploy command with the Validation Framework binary.
* the checks will be logged on the fs and the history could be retrieved
* the checks sometimes overlap existing validations, so converging those will
  avoid duplication.

commit_message:
WIP - Refactoring preflight checks and validations

The goal of this review is to refactor the preflight checks
for undercloud, tripleo and overcloud deploy in order to
centralized all those checks into a common place in tripleo-validations.
The major gain of this approach is:
* allow operators to run preflight checks on demmand, outside of the
  tripleo CLI deploy command with the Validation Framework binary.
* the checks will be logged on the fs and the history could be retrieved
* the checks sometimes overlap existing validations, so converging those will
  avoid duplication.

Change-Id: I165eb65c54a2767b916d947251771b5548cb7071

commit_message:
Release octavia for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to octavia since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.1..8abf181
1028bc24 Fix update/delete listener CA/CRL error
a25076a1 Fix HealthMonitorToErrorOnRevertTask revert method
8a7ece8a Fix potential race conditions on update requests in the v2 worker
ca66aac3 Fix duplicate object error messages
d0adca9a Set sensible nf_conntrack_max value in amphora
1e5c20c2 Correct format of release note
5d45e56b Fix disabled UDP pools
6c52fd0e Validate L7Rule value and cookie name
a870525d Fix new pylint issues
4503bd27 Reject invalid whitespace in HM url_path value
89fe4754 Remove unneeded sudo in lvs-masquerade.sh
2b2494d7 Fix compile_amphora_details when using UDP listeners
5d332357 Deny the creation of L7Policies for HTTPS/TCP/UDP listeners
3ee4acb6 Fix AttributeError in exception handler
97ac37bc Save the HAProxy state outside of its systemd unit
7bee4bdb Disabling octavia-grenade job in stable/wallaby
bf73410f Restart rsyslog from cloud-init
f0720d67 Pass timeout_dict to _get_haproxy_versions
3f134a29 Fix Amphora RSyslog configuration for TCP failover
9d93dc50 Use centos amphora image in the FIPS jobs
d7c25c3e Add fips jobs
2500987d Fix ipv6 interface configuration
a0196a64 Fix unplugging member ports
ce9a4356 Fix amphora-agent elements for RHEL9
82665fed Optimize DB object to provider dict conversions
b4806a83 Add keepalive for redis-based taskflow boards
0b013158 Fix detection of member operating status DRAIN
d14cc33b Fix amphora build in CentOS Stream 9
55bce250 Preserve haproxy server states during reloads
ba45c0b7 Replace md5 for fips
d7a20cf4 Update scripts to use fips allowed algorithms
1efeb8d5 Fix nft command line with negative priority values

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I80cf97d04b79b3e63a5ca77a674bf9acc1df5c32

commit_message:
Update replica state before promote.

During promote of replica, retrieve replica state from backend before
promotion. In case DB state is in-sync, but backend reports out-sync,
abort promotion.

Closes-bug: #1989126
Change-Id: I60cfaeef18cc9040d3d25c62490baddbf9767539

commit_message:
Define queues at project level

Defining queues at project.pipeline level was deprecated in release
4.1.0 of Zuul [1] and support for it will (probably) be dropped in
release 7.0.0. [2][3]

This patch isn't a clean cherry-pick since
we're including a bugfix for mysql-8 which is needed
by the unit tests running in the requirements check
job. We've to club these changes because the requirements
job is a voting job. [4]

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/latest/releasenotes.html#relnotes-4-1-0-deprecation-notes
[2] https://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028603.html
[3] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/manila/+/836342

Signed-off-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ife023187f307f1190d5e76daf644db0b5cd55d38
(cherry picked from commit 441d6470ca3a24f29f60494ed31755d2842b2fa3)

subject: ch-sync: IndentityServiceContext app data fixes
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-03 15:30:59.000000000', 'files': ['charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ssh_migrations.py', 'charmhelpers/fetch/ubuntu.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ha/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/storage/linux/utils.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/hahelpers/cluster.py', 'charmhelpers/core/host.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/ip.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templates/haproxy.cfg', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/vaultlocker.py', 'charmhelpers/core/unitdata.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/charmsupport/nrpe.py', 'charmhelpers/contrib/network/ip.py'], 'message': "ch-sync: IndentityServiceContext app data fixes

The IdentityServiceContext was recently updated to add the application
data bag. Unfortunately, they keystone charm uses both the regular
relation data primarily, but the updates for endpoints are on both the
application database and the regular relation data. The
IdentityServiceContext used the app data bag exclusively if there were
any keys available, which leads to it ignoring the existing relation
data entirely; this results in 'identity relation not ready' with
missing data items.

charm-helpers is patched at [1] to solve the issue and this is a
charm-helpers sync that includes that patch.  This changes the
functionality of the IdentityServiceContext so that it preferentially
selects keys from the application data bag unless they are None, in
which case it tries for those keys on the existing relation data. e.g.
it will stitch the two relations together with the app data bag taking
priority. This allows the nova-cloud-controller charm to correctly
access the identity relation data and form a complete context.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/746

Change-Id: Ic868213c6bb42bc2a28ad25a2f7344a28ab9f04d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
ch-sync: IndentityServiceContext app data fixes

The IdentityServiceContext was recently updated to add the application
data bag. Unfortunately, they keystone charm uses both the regular
relation data primarily, but the updates for endpoints are on both the
application database and the regular relation data. The
IdentityServiceContext used the app data bag exclusively if there were
any keys available, which leads to it ignoring the existing relation
data entirely; this results in 'identity relation not ready' with
missing data items.

charm-helpers is patched at [1] to solve the issue and this is a
charm-helpers sync that includes that patch.  This changes the
functionality of the IdentityServiceContext so that it preferentially
selects keys from the application data bag unless they are None, in
which case it tries for those keys on the existing relation data. e.g.
it will stitch the two relations together with the app data bag taking
priority. This allows the nova-cloud-controller charm to correctly
access the identity relation data and form a complete context.

[1] https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/746

Change-Id: Ic868213c6bb42bc2a28ad25a2f7344a28ab9f04d

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Remove impish bundles as EOL.
Make yoga voting as the charm on stable/yoga should support yoga.

Change-Id: Ia498b3fcbb22ad31b4a58b8c3979df5a1067e2b2

Infinidat driver doesn't support TLS/SSL communication

This patch adds support for SSL/TLS communication for
storage management operations. Use `infinidat_use_ssl`
under backend section to enable or disable TLS/SSL
communication between the Manila share service and the
storage backend. And `infinidat_suppress_ssl_warnings`
under backend section to suppress requests library SSL

Closes-Bug: #1986653
Signed-off-by: Alexander Deiter <adeiter@infinidat.com>

(cherry picked from commit 52dac7619469240987171640f6674bef56261fda)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[Infinidat] add support for TLS/SSL communication

Infinidat driver doesn't support TLS/SSL communication
and uses plain HTTP for storage management operations.

This patch adds support for SSL/TLS communication for
storage management operations. Use `infinidat_use_ssl`
under backend section to enable or disable TLS/SSL
communication between the Manila share service and the
storage backend. And `infinidat_suppress_ssl_warnings`
under backend section to suppress requests library SSL
certificate warnings.

Closes-Bug: #1986653
Signed-off-by: Alexander Deiter <adeiter@infinidat.com>
Change-Id: Ia6bbde9aa1702be83f737ab6876a522fa30381c7
(cherry picked from commit 52dac7619469240987171640f6674bef56261fda)

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Remove impish bundle.
Add libpq-dev for py310 test (pg_config required for install)

Change-Id: I1f3b68ef2cbd7423078959d633c60800e6f2b937

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for yoga

The bundles for the yoga channel currently point to "latest/edge"
channel for all the charms.  This update points the charms to the
appropriate channel for the charm being used, either from ceph,
openstack, ovn or the misc tracks.

Also remove impish as EOL, and make jammy-yoga voting.

Change-Id: Ifd111d333af00001a812fe5c4ecffe96ce7ca0c3

commit_message:
Implement automatic deploy of trove

this patchset has implemented:
  - network (trove-mgmt-net)
  - security groups and rules
  - nova keypair
Add trove trove_docker_* variables which are
used by trove guest-agent.

Implements: blueprint implement-automatic-deploy-of-trove
Change-Id: I6defbc0a914065d7f22d46d883cc4a71ead8f9a8

commit_message:
Speedup upload images for Swift backend

A new configuration option ``swift_store_thread_pool_size``
will be added to Swift store backend. This option will enable
parallel upload. Also, parallel upload is not supported if
buffered upload is enabled.

Upload images using Swift backend is slow due to the synchronous
way of uploading fragments and which causes loading that can take
several hours, especially in cases with very large images.

This only affects only the Swift backend.

Change-Id: Ie605675e919263e38262a322958479e821a7c98c

commit_message:
Add replace location test

Replacing locations is a little strange, in that you "replace" the
whole list of locations, but only metadata for existing locations
is allowed, but outside the JSON PATCH checking. This adds a test
that probes the boundaries of that and makes sure we are allowed
(and disallowed) the right operations.

Change-Id: I753872656b990741ababfbdd64893746493b5e13

subject: Check if Zuul API is reachable before try pulling logs
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-25 13:40:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Check if Zuul API is reachable before try pulling logs

The logscraper service when Zuul API is down, it is raise an
exception and the service is going to stop, but the logscraper
service is controlled by systemd, which is periodically restarting
the service.
This patch is checking if the Zuul API is reachable before pull,
so it should not raise an exception and service should be running
for long time.

Change-Id: Idbe9b2024d0d049df26cf857a5309c3b9e42b80e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2022-10-26 08:57:10.000000000', 'files': ['logscraper/tests/test_logscraper.py', 'logscraper/logscraper.py'], 'message': 'Check if Zuul API is reachable before try pulling logs

The logscraper service when Zuul API is down, it is raise an
exception and the service is going to stop, but the logscraper
service is controlled by systemd, which is periodically restarting
the service.
This patch is checking if the Zuul API is reachable before pull,
so it should not raise an exception and service should be running
for long time.

Change-Id: Idbe9b2024d0d049df26cf857a5309c3b9e42b80e
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Check if Zuul API is reachable before try pulling logs

The logscraper service when Zuul API is down, it is raise an
exception and the service is going to stop, but the logscraper
service is controlled by systemd, which is periodically restarting
the service.
This patch is checking if the Zuul API is reachable before pull,
so it should not raise an exception and service should be running
for long time.

Change-Id: Idbe9b2024d0d049df26cf857a5309c3b9e42b80e

commit_message:
Fix host:port handling

When we check the EC2 signature without the port part of the host value
received, we should properly split host:port. Keep in mind the splitting
should work for values like [fc00::]:123 too.

Change-Id: I1d90dfcea3568e2a9b22069daa428ea6a2a38bd6
Closes-Bug: #1988168

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-09-26 12:41:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for Napatech LinkVirt SmartNICs

Napatech LinkVirtualization SmartNICs offload network traffic switching, QoS, and tunnel encapsulation/decapsulation functions from the OVS running on the hypervisor to the on-board silicon. This patch updates the Nova source code to include support for a new VIF type corresponding to the virtual devices exposed by the LinkVirtualization SmartNIC.

commit_message:
Add support for Napatech LinkVirt SmartNICs

Napatech LinkVirtualization SmartNICs offload network traffic switching, QoS, and tunnel encapsulation/decapsulation functions from the OVS running on the hypervisor to the on-board silicon. This patch updates the Nova source code to include support for a new VIF type corresponding to the virtual devices exposed by the LinkVirtualization SmartNIC.

Change-Id: I2df34bbf4031384e008cbc642ca15291501dfe53

commit_message:
[neutron] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: I164cd2e7f995253b83d013fb0cf223f953f333d9

commit_message:
[designate] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

commit_message:
[manila] Transition Wallaby to EM

This transition the wallaby branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

The transition deadline is November 2nd, 2022.

Change-Id: Iab06113f4e9347aff6e9de094781703043eb0fe7

commit_message:
Upload image chunks in parallel to Swift

PUT operation for images is slow due to synchronous chunks uploading.
To speed up this operation, the patch uses a `ThreadPoolExecutor`
to split the chunk to be uploaded.

This only affects only the Swift backend.

Depends-On: Ie605675e919263e38262a322958479e821a7c98c
Change-Id: I628612d3491e199c3756c013a10de0ee48033b09

changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that

leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.1.2..3d844d6bc
3d844d6bc [Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules
da7101f17 Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

Change-Id: Ic53040abc7a77c4f00b04ed57a6abe660a6ff400
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Release manila for stable/wallaby

This release picks up new commits to manila since
the last release from stable/wallaby.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.1.2..3d844d6bc
3d844d6bc [Native CephFS] Don't fail to deny missing rules
da7101f17 Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing
7102626e1 [CI] Install dependencies for docs target

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ic53040abc7a77c4f00b04ed57a6abe660a6ff400

commit_message:
Updating Zuul CI jobs for os-net-config repo

Updated the Zuul CI layout.yaml to replace the gate job
‘openstack-tox-pep8’ with the check job
‘tripleo-ci-centos-9-content-provider’ (which has a
dependency on ‘openstack-tox-pep8’ in the os-net-config repo CI)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4fb9c62e23cdc28e69b7e51616ab81b18f65d4bc

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iee5cd41d3390f4fe872715949b8091b3de0b46f9

commit_message:
Skip removal of Mellanox NICs' ifcfg-* scripts

os-net-config is triggering reconfiguration/flapping of
mellanox nics even when there are no changes in the NIC configs.
Added check to NOT remove ifcfg-* scripts for Mellonox NICs when
DPDK/Bond is enabled

Change-Id: If26bbdf1a4c286f24fa0b37e555271af05d9cb03

commit_message:
Use daemon property instead of setDaemon method

The setDaemon method of the threading.Thread was deprecated
in Python 3.10 (*).
Replace the setDaemon method with the daemon property.

*: https://docs.python.org/3.10/library/threading.html#threading.Thread.setDaemon

Change-Id: Id4b6df45ba4741e410692df7bd11db3f56f00f45
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I63d82d5f24454dc49e5c8bbeb8e9debaff704066

subject: Improve map_merge logging
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-11-03 01:20:55.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py'], 'message': "Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

With this change, instead of just saying an error occured,
we will now return the object that the error occurred with
and a note about it's type. This will allow for quick
identification of what the problem was.

Change-Id: I8661ae43fb86a842096e5ad86a54839feac04839
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

With this change, instead of just saying an error occured,
we will now return the object that the error occurred with
and a note about it's type. This will allow for quick
identification of what the problem was.

Change-Id: I8661ae43fb86a842096e5ad86a54839feac04839

commit_message:
Improve map_merge logging

Templates can be complex and contain multiple instances of
map_merges. Debugging this can be complex, so this change
aims to improve the mapping and help users determine where
the problem has occured.

With this change, instead of just saying an error occured,
we will now return the object that the error occurred with
and a note about it's type. This will allow for quick
identification of what the problem was.

Change-Id: I70502525f49298bf5c395d9a68c4564fd724a628

commit_message:
WIP Drop python2 from bindep.txt

IPA dropped support for Python2 long ago,
and now Python2 is not even available in newer distros,
breaking installation if IPA binary dependencies.

WIP because we should consider switching the check-requirements job to
use a bionic node instead of jammy, or remove it entirely

Change-Id: I75a618f94de58f6de2bd96b37de1894bb0e61998
(cherry picked from commit 6e2f70ec7dc0de99c6f85499e50b80a3ea14c8d1)

', 'number': 24}, {'created': '2022-03-08 11:11:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Reset state robustification for group-snapshot os-reset_status

This commit changes the os-reset_status group-snapshot-api
to handle the below use cases

1.reset a group-snapshot to the 'deleting' or 'error_deleting'
status is now disallowed

NOTE: with this change, some requests that previously succeeded will
return a 400.  However, these were requests that would leave a resource
in an inconsistent state with an inaccurate status, so a 400 is
appropriate.  We use a 400 (not 409) to be consistent with the current
Block Storage API. This change is not microversioned because it doesn't
make sense to only prevent operators from shooting themselves in the

commit_message:
Reset state robustification for group-snapshot os-reset_status

This commit changes the os-reset_status group-snapshot-api
to handle the below use cases

1.reset a group-snapshot to the 'deleting' or 'error_deleting'
status is now disallowed

NOTE: with this change, some requests that previously succeeded will
return a 400.  However, these were requests that would leave a resource
in an inconsistent state with an inaccurate status, so a 400 is
appropriate.  We use a 400 (not 409) to be consistent with the current
Block Storage API. This change is not microversioned because it doesn't
make sense to only prevent operators from shooting themselves in the
foot if they happen to specify an appropriate microversion,
and be grievously wounded otherwise.

Partial implement blueprint reset-state-robustification

Change-Id: I7982ed4d1bf7df918a281548a3c8d075a8db4086

commit_message:
Add port/portgroup list conductor groups filter

Allow filtering on conductor groups when listing ports
and portgroups.

Bumps the API microversion to 1.81
Bumps object versions:
 Port      to 1.11
 Portgroup to 1.5

Story: 2010373
Task: 46611

commit_message:
proxy: Minimize cached shard-ranges for updating

We don't need to be dumping/loading whole shard ranges, just the name
and bounds. Hold off on instantiating the actual ShardRange object until
the last possible moment.

Change-Id: I448350ec59a697650b6f99ddfa8ff87f6f2e6a81

commit_message:
wsgi: Pass worker pids to new manager when reloading

This allows the new manager to recognize them as they exit instead of
logging

   Ignoring wait() result from unknown PID ...

With the improved knowledge of subprocesses, we can kick the log level
for the above message up to warning; we no longer expect it to trigger
in practice.

Additionally, add a new tunable, `stale_worker_timeout`. Once this many
seconds pass following a reload, the manager process will issue SIGKILLs
to the remaining stale workers. This ensures there is some limit to how
long old code and configs may still be running.

Drive-by: Add logging to ServersPerPortStrategy.register_worker_exit
that's comparable to what WorkersStrategy does.

Change-Id: I8227939d04fda8db66fb2f131f2c71ce8741c7d9

subject: Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9816, 'name': 'Takashi Kajinami', 'email': 'tkajinam@redhat.com', 'username': 'kajinamit'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}, {'_account_id': 30073, 'name': 'Brendan Shephard', 'email': 'bshephar@redhat.com', 'username': 'bshephar'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-10-26 13:45:24.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

 Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Related: rhbz#2135675
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411
(cherry picked from commit 18824865c03efb702f34164408f2a95b1f58f417)
(cherry picked from commit ceb01aec509e3478424b8b71af3af158bed13727)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_libvirt_max_queues_set conditions for nova-compute

A typical pattern to check for a feature gate by a param and its role
param (there are more types of checking, this one is for negation):
foo_gate_enabled:
  not:
    and:
      - equals: [{get_param: foo_val}, <null_val>]
      - equals: [{get_param: [RoleParameters, foo_val]}, <null_val>]

which is consider the feature gate OFF, only if both of its tht param
and role params are holding empty/falsey (null) values. If either holds
a not-null value, consider the condition is True, and treat the feature
gate as enabled.

For the nova compute service template, we follow that pattern when
checking permit_auto_converge_set, permit_post_copy_set,
reserved_huge_pages_set.

But we do not, when we check it for libvirt_file_backed_memory_enabled
and nova_libvirt_max_queues_set. And consider the feature disabled, if
*either of* the tht, or role param holds a null value. As a result,
when we define NovaLibvirtMaxQueues, or NovaLibvirtFileBackedMemory,
but have nothing for those in roles params, the features will not
become enabled.

 Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Related: rhbz#2135675
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie16ab2ab5836ed455aeda35d2ba619633a595411
(cherry picked from commit 18824865c03efb702f34164408f2a95b1f58f417)
(cherry picked from commit ceb01aec509e3478424b8b71af3af158bed13727)

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Ib5ea1e022e624a57374b0c2d365d68452af08085
